website_summaries.verdict: A handy tool for quick aerating jobs over a small area; the spikes penetrate harder soils that core-type aerators may struggle with.
pros: Tough, sturdy spikes punch fairly easily into harder soils like clay
Works best in short-term for small patches or smaller lawns
cons: Tool handle is a bit short for taller people
Foot rest is somewhat narrow and tough to access in work boots

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for areas of my backyard. Easy for me to use (senior citizen). Works great. I gave it an overall 4 stars becauseIt probably doesn't go under the roots of the grass as the tines aren't terribly long, but I think it does what I can handle and what I expected. Foot rest is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hill

customer_reviews.title: Bleh... Not impressed. Save your $
customer_reviews.text: OK product, overall. However, I agree with most of the comments. Good for small patches on the lawn - if that. Saw that the spikes were 3 inches in length but didn't check the diameter. It's really not enough to penetrate in order to aerate the lawn - especially, if hard clay. Recommend you purchase some 2x4's, cut them off to one foot, drive some 16 penny nails into them, and strap them to your feet with some bungee cords. You'll likely get the same outcome, if not better results.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Slow process, works ok, can get clumps
customer_reviews.text: This will definitely give you a workout as it is very slow. What do you expect though with just a handful of spikes. They dont dull and are strong. Typical issue of dirt sometimes clogging on it. Strong good material though and has worked well for small areas.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle2here

customer_reviews.title: This is a shoddy and poorly crafted tool
customer_reviews.text: First use the tong bend and the joint cracked... poor craftsmanship overall... not for anything more than pulling out flowers or turning soil... I was pulling on a half inch tree stump that had been cut 6" from the ground and left for a year to loosen and degrade... The tong bent in first go...
customer_reviews.author: Paul Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Too small for using on my front lawn. Good for very small patches of lawn. Now I use it stirring compost in my bin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small yard.
customer_reviews.text: It's a heavy metal stick with a handle and 4 forks. Not to complicated. The construction looks solid and rust-proof for many years and the padding on the handlebar is a nice bonus. For a small yard it is great! For a medium-large yard, look at something else unless you want to spend your whole Saturday going step by step through your grass with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: As described and seems well-made
customer_reviews.text: The plug/core models might be better for your lawn, but this is sure easier to use. Sturdy design seems to get the job done and I expect it to last a long time. First uses were great.
customer_reviews.author: Maryland Dad

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, if your buff
customer_reviews.text: I am not so will not be using it. Great product, well made, I won't return it. I just didn't understand how hard aerating 4,000 ft would be manually.
customer_reviews.author: The Allan Family

customer_reviews.title: OK For It's Original Intention.
customer_reviews.text: The Over All Is Good But Could Be Thicker Or Sturdier Material Which Would Add A Little More Weight To The Usefulness. Over All I Give It A 3 Out Of 5 for Sturdness.
customer_reviews.author: commodore c. collins

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works great for small lawns, it best if you got some body weight so when you stand on it, it will easily go down into the soil.
customer_reviews.author: dog art

customer_reviews.title: To do job.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best. Dirt comes up. have to clean in between spokes after use.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra A.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, fast shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Got here in 2 days, very fast. Works well. I prefer this type of aerator over a core aerator because it never clogs.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: got time?
customer_reviews.text: The product works well, for smaller areas. Time consuming to use, but kinda fun!
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: For a small yard
customer_reviews.text: This would not work for a large yard, or at least it would take forever to aerate a large space. But, I have a small yard and was not looking to spend a ton of money... and this is perfect! This is very well made and I can't imagine any of the spikes ever breaking. It is simple enough to use and it has helped perk up my lawn. I know this will last a very long time since it is metal, not plastic. If you have a small yard, this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Super Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Product purchase
customer_reviews.text: It was utilized for its intended purpose. Glad I made the purchase.Would purchase again if needed
customer_reviews.author: Ogsan1

customer_reviews.title: Works!  So eco-friendly.
customer_reviews.text: This worked so well, I mean really what COULD go wrong with it. We aerated the entire lawn (7000 SF), just worked at it a little at a time until it was done. The lawn came in beautifully. I like how it was quiet, no fumes, no maintenance-still sharp and it's hanging there in the garage taking up very little space til next time we want to do this again. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: after using this to 'aerate' -- I dropped seeds into the holes and all the seeds are growing -- I know this is not truly aerating, rather pushing the soil to the sides while creating a spiked hole. I bought this because I wanted to create a better base for the seeds to grow. I also have the other Yard Butler true aerator that I've used as well.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I have a fairly large old yard that needs new grass, this aerator was a lot more expensive on other websites.
customer_reviews.author: P in PA

customer_reviews.title: ROCKS
customer_reviews.text: This aerator rocks I have lots of clay in my yard never get good plugs but with this it pushes right through the clay nice 3" holes you will see Your grass get greener in a week love it. Very addicting once you start making holes you just keep going kind of fun not hard work brainless. Built to last season after season. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey B

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and does a good job
customer_reviews.text: This is well-made and works well. I tried other solutions, including the strap-on shoes with spikes, but this is the only tool I have found that works. You can put your foot on the bottom cross bar and use your body weight to aerate your lawn. It was not difficult at all, only took me about 30 minutes to aerate my entire lawn which is average size.
customer_reviews.author: EvanstonIrish

customer_reviews.title: Pokerator Master
customer_reviews.text: Good tool but does not pull carrots of dirt instead it pokes holes. It helps drainage in wet spots. Well made tool that should last several years.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Solid product & a good workout
customer_reviews.text: Step up, push down, repeat every six to ten inches across your lawn. It works. Nothing fancy, just be prepared for some sore muscles from the repeated effort.
customer_reviews.author: dstucke

customer_reviews.title: Well-built tool. Should have bought it sooner
customer_reviews.text: Well-built yard tool. Saw improvement in soil drainage immediately. Reccomend soaking ground for a few days prior to first use and even as you use it to lessen work load.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yard Butler M-7C
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small yard therefore this product is perfect. This product is very well-made, durable and easy to use. I highly recommend this item to purchase especially if you have a small yard or isolated patches. You will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Barker

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: works perfectly. Just what i needed. Very well made too.
customer_reviews.author: anthoneyc

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. did the job on aerating my grass.
customer_reviews.author: RDHS

customer_reviews.title: Great for small yards
customer_reviews.text: I just received it yesterday, but tried it out today. It's easy to use, even in a yard with a lot of red clay. I do think it would be time consuming in a larger yard, but it worked great in my small front yard.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Anne Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Spike Aerator
customer_reviews.text: This Spike Aerator works very well here in Florida for the Floratam grass! This stimulates the roots to grow and fill in bare areas of the lawn. It is easy to use and I do not have to step on the aerator very hard to go into the sandy soil here. It helps to save on spending money for sod! So far, I have saved $200 by using this on my lawn and not buying sod.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hauser

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last very long , broke after second use
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy , as far as the spikes go. One fell completely out and the others are bent, after the second time that we used it.
customer_reviews.author: christi714

customer_reviews.title: Lawn aerator
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item not to aerate my lawn but to poke ant nests to see if the nest was live or dead. If live, the ants would swarm to protect their nest and I would then powder the top of the nest to get the food to kill the queen and therefore kill the nest. It works great, even for ants that do not build recognizable mounds.
customer_reviews.author: Dyonisious 45

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy and gets teh job done.
customer_reviews.text: When using it definitely helps to use after it has rained. I live in the Fort Worth, TX area and we are regularly under water restrictions and this tool absolutely helps me maximize my water savings by making sure the rain water AND the city water make it to where it needs to be. This is very important when you can only water twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: David Shoffitt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works great in garden/yard. Sturdy and holds up well. Good product
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Good value, handles need updating.
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, works as advertised. One thing- the soft handles get degraded by the sun and eventually become a spongy, sticky mess. Replace them with universal 7/8" plastic handle covers from the hardware store. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Pcola

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: This works well but I don't last long when using it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. Hudspeth

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It really is easy to use. I definitely can see that my lawn looks better after having used this.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ITEM
customer_reviews.text: Been lookin for one of these gizmos for a long time!!!! Just had 2 120 ft. maple trees removed and had to replant a lot of lawn. Have used a pitchfork in the past but got tired of unclogging same. Also, must say that the item was received in 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: billy bones

customer_reviews.title: Tool to aerate and seed small lawn areas.
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced, works as promised, would not recommend for large yard, but great for lawn patches that need to be aerated and re-seeded, or smaller yards.
customer_reviews.author: PA Resident

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but I wish the spikes were a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Christine S.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this for aerating small patchy spots
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to but not intended for a full lawn. I would recommend this for aerating small patchy spots.
customer_reviews.author: Anna muszynski

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Great for aerating small areas of your ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Great for aerating small areas of your yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Gerrish

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this thing is awesome! very sturdy, and has a good weight to it. I don't see it or the needle tips bending in tough areas.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Vera

customer_reviews.title: Great for softening and moisturizing garden soil
customer_reviews.text: Nice small size for working in small gardens, in between plantings. I use it to push coffee grounds, crushed egg shells, and even sand into the garden dirt so it doesn't get so hard for the plants or me to live and work with.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Lawn Aerator
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Although, it is a workout on your arms if you are aerating even a medium sized lawn. I would not use this for anything more than a very small lawn. My yard is about .20 of an acre and my arms are shot after doing the whole thing. I would say only use this product for .10 of an acre or less. Good quality and good product for small lawns.
customer_reviews.author: Hippo Hero

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I'm just glad we have a small yard since this is manual - but it does work very well. Best to use it on a wet/saturated lawn, just not in August in south Texas. Fast shipping and a very durable yard tool - Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jets_Books

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: High quality and does what you'd expect. Basically just some metal with some thick nails on the bottom. Stomp away!
customer_reviews.author: Deez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty works good no complaints other then its a work out.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler Soy Candles

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: This is very well built and great for my small lawn. Do as others suggest and water your lawn thoroughly and the spikes sink in easily. As this has 4 spikes and says to make holes every 6-8in be prepared for a workout! I keep my foot in the slot and hobble around my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Peanut

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and well built. It's been helpful in prepping my grass and in new seed planting (as well as water retention).
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Good spike aerator
customer_reviews.text: Makes bigger holes than foot aerator for better seeding results
customer_reviews.author: JAMES CHRISTHILF

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to use. Made to handle a small area. My lawn is only 20' x 20'. It is very sturdy and will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: happydays

customer_reviews.title: Works great for tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: Well built and easy to use. I wish the handle was about a foot longer. It functions much better then I expected. I recommend it for small or tight areas. Fast delivery via Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: DBH2

customer_reviews.title: spot aerating
customer_reviews.text: This tool is great for aerating some small areas that are struggling. Very well built. Will get the old ticker a'thumpin.
customer_reviews.author: Catalina Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job of poking my yard. Plus it looks like some medieval torture device so would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really solid. I don't know how you could bend or break a tine. Maybe the 2013 model is improved since the previous complaints. I recommend it for small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: jim p

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price.hope you don't have a whole yard to do.you will be at it all day.good to do a small area with.
customer_reviews.author: joseph devito

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and store
customer_reviews.text: exacatly what I needed. well contructed tool. easy to use and store.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Soto

customer_reviews.title: Well made and works great
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for small yards. After using this product on my lawn I noticed after a week of watering that the grass was coming in better. The Yard Butler is well made and not to heavy for my wife to use as well. Would recommend this product to anyone looking for improvement in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: JFuggyFugg

customer_reviews.title: Repeated use only dulls this already dull product.
customer_reviews.text: I am highly unimpressed with this item. It lacks the strength to get into the ground and after repeated use I have seen no benefit from its purchase. Others may have better luck, but if you have clay soil I would suggest a coring device rather than an aerator. If you must go aerator try a more solid product with a sharper set of tines, this will not help you.
customer_reviews.author: W. Young

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN EXPECTED!
customer_reviews.text: This item is built very well - very heavy duty. No flimsy steel here. The handles are padded and the steel is very thick and strong. I don't think you could bend it if you wanted to. Works as well as it is built. I would highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: in808

customer_reviews.title: these are solid and slip easily in and out of the ground
customer_reviews.text: Unlike aerators with tube prongs, these are solid and slip easily in and out of the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Aerator
customer_reviews.text: This aerator is great for getting and keeping water on plants, as well as for lawns, and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald A. Gorshe

customer_reviews.title: good results at low price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price, good results. Tines are a little small so it takes extra effort but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: J. Waggoner

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, bit expensive though
customer_reviews.text: works very well, i think i paid too much though, i thought is was free shipping, it was not.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Although labor intensive, the aerator works well in semi-moist soil. It seems quite well made.
customer_reviews.author: William Maier

customer_reviews.title: Spot Aeration
customer_reviews.text: It's well made and it appears will last a long time. Product was described accuately in marketing message.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just wish it had a few more spikes to cover more ground quicker.
customer_reviews.author: sccsuf

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use on my small lawn
customer_reviews.text: The Yard Butler is a small sturdily built garden tool. It was easy to use and penetrated the ground with very little effort. The instructions included were clear and easy to follow. If you have a small lawn, this is a very helpful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: This is a good lawn spike for me because I have a small ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good lawn spike for me because I have a small lawn to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to aerate my lawn before planting new grass. This aerator did the job perfectly. It was lightweight and easy to maneuver. I am five foot one so it was perfect for my size.
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline francis

customer_reviews.title: Works as Intended
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Works a lot better in damp soil. Put it on the ground, step on it, wiggle it back and forth about 30 degrees each way, pull out, repeat.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Abe

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: takes to long to get the holes punched other than that its great for what its suppose to do easy to use
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: It is a well designed product that has improved my front and back lawn with thicker growth, and drainage, it is great!
customer_reviews.author: william McGee

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: It loses 1 star because it does take a lot of work to go around the yard poking holes in it. There has got to be a better way! Overall, this is a good product and I like that it has 4 spikes instead of 2 like most aerators do.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Aerator
customer_reviews.text: Not anywhere as near useful as I'd hoped. Slow and a lot of hard work for very little gain. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Great addition!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy to use lawn aerator. Would recommend this product for breaking up hard ground to accept grass seed or sod.
customer_reviews.author: Judy A. Doherty

customer_reviews.title: and you are better off with a mechanized tool
customer_reviews.text: It works. But if you have a big lawn, this is going to be hard work, and you are better off with a mechanized tool.
customer_reviews.author: Thinking man

customer_reviews.title: great aerator
customer_reviews.text: I used the aerator myself and it worked well. Was delivered in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L. Biesemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Yard Butler Aerator Works
customer_reviews.text: Good product, pleased with the purchase so far. Seems well-built, sturdy. Does what it is supposed to do. Because it just has 4 spikes, it will give you a workout if you do a large area. But good for small yards.
customer_reviews.author: G. Payne

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and functional. I think it'll hold up well and does penetrate the compacted soil in my side yard well.
customer_reviews.author: eid8801

customer_reviews.title: Great yard tool
customer_reviews.text: I love this little tool for small areas. I can aerate a small area without any problem. It makes the job so easy!
customer_reviews.author: Duluth Collies

customer_reviews.title: Aerator Solutions
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect product for aerating a small yard. It is sturdy, well made and easy to use. It does what its intend to do...prepare your lawn for seeding.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Received bent.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well made but arrived with severely bent rod and handle although box used for shipping was unscathed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband is the one that wanted to purchase this to use on our lawn. He states that it works great and would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: LLT

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: It is everything I expected! I love it. I would recommend this to a friend!!! My yard is starting to look better already.
customer_reviews.author: Frank G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you have absolutely nothing to do.
customer_reviews.text: All in all I would not have bought it. For a very small area I guess it would be great, but for larger areas just have somebody do lawn aeration
customer_reviews.author: george seward

customer_reviews.title: Spike broke off
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this tool, I was very happy with it. It looked like it was very well made. But after only the second time using it, one of the spikes broke off. I would not recommend this tool, especially for large lawns.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Holt

customer_reviews.title: Good item and good service
customer_reviews.text: I agree with BL's review of June 26, 2008. The Yard Butler Spike Aerator #M-7C is solidly made. It came quickly from the BIC Superstore via Amazon and was packed carefully. It is useful for spot aeration. We also have just a few crabgrass plants each year, and we use the product to loosen the soil and then pull out the plant by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Leeman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lawn Spike
customer_reviews.text: I get lots of use out of this spike, and my lawn looks the better for it. I'm not in a hurry. I like using it. It really gets the job done to my satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Sexton

product_meta.title: Yard Butler M-7C Lawn Spike Aerator
product_meta.description:
Size:1Lewis Multi-Spike Lawn Aerator 36in Four hardened spikes loosen compacted soil, allowing deep watering for greener lawns.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Is Your Lawn Gasping For Air?The Yard Butler Spike Aerator has sharp spikes that slip into the ground to loosen the soil, and a smooth, strong "powder coated" resin finish that resists rusting . Old lawns and lawns where a lot of activity takes place become compacted. Also thatch from dead leaves builds up creating a barrier, keeping water and air from reaching the roots. The symptoms are thin turf with poor color and bare patches that don't respond to watering and fertilizer.
feature_bullets: Four hardened spikes loosen compacted soil, allowing deep watering for greener lawns
This product is made in China
Four 3-inch spikes penetrate and loosen compacted soil
Spike aeration loosens soil and thatch to let air, water, and fertilizer down to the roots
Spike aeration also stimulates root growth by separating the roots
Your lawn will look better with less water and fertilizer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars185 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
